about_the_game:
Lair of the Locksmith is a puzzle game about keys, experimentation and logic.

Your goal is to rescue imprisoned goblins from a dwarvish citadel full of locked doors. The focus is squarely on puzzle-solving, rather than precision-platforming. You combine keys to create new keys which can unlock doors and open up more rooms.

Which door should you unlock next? Which keys should you use? Can you get this key to that door without touching other keys?


  • A multitude of handcrafted single-screen levels each with a unique challenge.
  • Made a mistake? Hold down Rewind to smoothly reverse time.
  • Level seems impossible? Experiment and discover a new tactic.
  • Totally stuck? There are often other unlocked levels to try.
  • Boxes: you can jump on them, carry them, put keys on them or stack them.
  • Cursed keys: they leap into your hands and don't want to be dropped.
  • Heavy keys: you can't jump with them, be careful if you drop one!
  • Chickens.

The key to solving the locksmith's puzzles is to solve the puzzle of the locksmith's keys.

Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or later
  • Processor: Intel i5 or similar
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL3.0, 256 MB NVidia, ATI, or Intel
  • Storage: 300 MB available space

short_description: A subtle and challenging logic puzzle platformer. Combine magic keys to unlock doors, find more keys, unlock more doors and rescue your fellow goblins from the lair of a devious dwarvish locksmith.
